utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I was reading about this jellyfish that never dies. Instead, it reverts to its asexual state and then grows up again.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: We thought my 90-year-old grandfather had reverted to an asexual state, but the lawsuit from his Jamaican caregiver proved us all wrong.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: My point is, immortality is not only a possibility, it is real.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Only if you’re this jellyfish which periodically reverts to a mass of undifferentiated protoplasm.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: If I could keep my Gmail account, I’d be okay with that.

utterance.speaker: Barry
utterance.content: – Hewwo, fewwas.

utterance.speaker: All
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Barry
utterance.content: Wemember when we were twying to figuwe out what that smell coming fwom Pwofessor Tupperman’s office was?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Yeah?

utterance.speaker: Barry
utterance.content: Turns out it was Tupperman. Dead at his desk for two weeks.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: That’s terrible.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, my God.

utterance.speaker: Barry
utterance.content: In wieu of fwowers, the department chair is asking that evewyone donate a bottle of Febweze.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: If we’re going to change the topic from jellyfish, I’d be okay with brine shrimp or the history of the unicycle.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Show a little compassion, a man died.

utterance.speaker: Barry
utterance.content: And turned into a puddew of goo. Now, we can either sit awound and cwy over spilt pwofessor, or we can wejoice in the knowwedge that a tenured position has just opened up. I choose to do the watter.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Excuse me, the whole tenure system is ridiculous. A guaranteed job for life only encourages the faculty to become complacent. If we really want science to advance, people should have chips implanted in their skulls that explode when they say something stupid.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Well, I believe people do their best work when they feel safe and secure.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Pchew!

utterance.speaker: Barry
utterance.content: If you need my nose, you’ll find it firmwy wodged up the qectum of the tenure committee.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: You Ph.D’s gonna go suck up like Kripke?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No. I mean, I’ll apply, but I’m not gonna stoop to playing politics.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Yeah, me neither. It should be about the work. And if I can’t get tenure, I’d like to see you or Sheldon get it.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Raj, don’t dangle false hope in front of Leonard like that.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Excuse me, but I think I’m just as qualified as you are.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Pchew! Pchew! Pchew! Pchew!

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: So tenured means a job for life?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yup.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: You can’t get fired even if you’re bad at it?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Mm, not really.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Wow, sounds a lot like being a pretty waitress at the Cheesecake Factory.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: While I disagree with the premise of tenure, if they gave it to me, it wouldn’t diminish my output. You know, I’m like the sun. Can’t turn this off.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Are Rajesh and Leonard competing for it as well?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Mm-hmm.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Do they know they don’t stand a chance ’cause you’re so great?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well put. You know, I must say I go back and forth on this boyfriend-girlfriend thing, but those moments when you worship me really keep you in the running.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: It would be nice to have the increased income. Stop taking money from my parents.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Money from family does come with strings attached.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: You have no idea. They buy me a new BMW for my birthday but can I get seat warmers? No. Rajesh, if you want a warm butt, you’re gonna have to pay for it yourself. Well, maybe I will, old man.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: I think that’s enough wine for now.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I just keep thinking about how cool it would be if I called my mom and told her that I got tenure at Caltech.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: She’d be proud, huh?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, very. Assuming she takes my call.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: My primary concern with being granted tenure is living with an insanely jealous roommate after the fact. I might need to sleep with a gun under my pillow. Or a chainsaw.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Or you take advantage of your newfound economic stability and move out, buy a house, get married. start a family.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Or, the chainsaw.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: And I will return to New Delhi in triumph atop a bejeweled white elephant. And you know what will be on that elephant’s back? A seat warmer. No, Father, you may not have a ride.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: I’m gonna make some coffee.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: So, who do you have to schmooze to get this deal?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I’m not gonna schmooze anybody. I’m gonna let my work speak for itself.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: That’s great. That shows a lot of integrity.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Thank you. I’m a naive idiot, right?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, good, you heard me.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: You know, if you really want tenure, maybe you should cozy up to the people making the decision.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Sheldon Cooper does not do cozy.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: You don’t say.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: But I suppose it wouldn’t hurt to know who’s on the committee. Let’s see. Oh, Janine Davis. Oh, dear.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Is that a problem?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well…

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Even you. You’re a slave.

utterance.speaker: Janine
utterance.content: I’m a what?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’m not sure, it could go either way.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hey-hey-hey-hey-hey. Mrs. Davis.

utterance.speaker: Janine
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Janine
utterance.content: Dr. Hofstadter.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yeah. Just thought I’d come down and start getting ready for swimsuit season.

utterance.speaker: Janine
utterance.content: Good for you.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Not that you need it. I bet you look great in a swimsuit.

utterance.speaker: Janine
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I’ve got what my father used to call furniture disease. My chest is falling into my drawers. I’m not, uh, familiar with this model. How do I make it start?

utterance.speaker: Janine
utterance.content: You push start.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Right. This one might be broken.

utterance.speaker: Janine
utterance.content: You have to move.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Got it. Oh. There. Oh, yeah. Yeah, now I’m feeling it. Oh, this is great. I could do this for the rest of my life. Hey, speaking, speaking of things you do for the rest of your life, uh, did I read that you’re on that-that tenure committee?

utterance.speaker: Janine
utterance.content: Yep. I got to get a home gym.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Well, I’m sure you have a lot of good applicants, I just wanted to say hi and let you know that I’ll be throwing my hat in the ring.

utterance.speaker: Janine
utterance.content: All right, I’ll keep an eye out for that.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Barry
utterance.content: Hey, Hofstadter. Funny seeing you here for the first time in… ever.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Go away.

utterance.speaker: Barry
utterance.content: Janine the Machine, wet’s do this!

utterance.speaker: Janine
utterance.content: Hey, Barry.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Well, look at that. Burned a whole calorie.

utterance.speaker: Barry
utterance.content: I guess you got here ewwy to burn off that banana bwead I baked you.

utterance.speaker: Janine
utterance.content: Yeah, it was delicious. Thank you.

utterance.speaker: Barry
utterance.content: No, my pweasure.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, if you, if you like banana bread, I’ve got a-a great recipe. The trick is in, in fresh ground, I’ll e-mail it to you.

utterance.speaker: Barry
utterance.content: Aw wight, I’m warm. Weady to kick it up a notch?

utterance.speaker: Janine
utterance.content: Let’s go.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: That’s enough cardio for me. I’m just gonna stretch out before I hit the weights.

utterance.speaker: Janine
utterance.content: You okay?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Call someone.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Good day, Mrs. Davis. This is Dr. Rajesh Koothrappali from the astrophysics department. Don’t be alarmed, I’m not really in space. Anyhoo, I’d like to take this opportunity to tell you about myself, so sit back, relax and enjoy the following 90-minute video.

utterance.speaker: Janine
utterance.content: Oh, come on.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Born in New Delhi, the third son of an itinerant gynecologist, I showed early signs of genius. At the age of five I discovered a celestial object which later turned out to be the moon.

utterance.speaker: Shelldon (off)
utterance.content: Mrs Davis? Mrs Davis? Mrs Davis?

utterance.speaker: Janine
utterance.content: God, they’re everywhere. Come in. Dr. Cooper, how can I help you?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yes, hello. I’m fine. Um, I understand you may have a bad impression of me, so I bought you a gift.

utterance.speaker: Janine
utterance.content: Uh, Dr. Cooper, that’s not necessary.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: It’s too late. Get ready to like me.

utterance.speaker: Janine
utterance.content: Roots?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: The tragic history of slavery in America. Fun for the whole family.

utterance.speaker: Janine
utterance.content: Why would you think this is an appropriate gift?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Um… Well… You are black, right?

utterance.speaker: Janine
utterance.content: This meeting has come to an end.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Because you want to start watching it right now. Copy that. Let’s see. Up next on the tenure committee is Professor Wu. Well, get ready for the complete works of Jackie Chan.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Gentlemen.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Where have you been?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Nurse’s office.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Asthma attack?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Asthma, heart, some kind of attack. I’m fine, though.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: You guys going to Professor Tupperman’s memorial?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I don’t know.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Probably not.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Barely knew him.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Yeah, you wouldn’t want to look like you guys are brown-nosing the tenure committee, who will all be there. Oh, yeah, that’s what I was hoping for, meerkats.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I won’t be able to make our date night this Thursday, so, bad news for you.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Well you better have a good excuse this time, because trimming Q-tips to fit your ears right is obvious nonsense.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: First of all, when you say things like that, people think you’re crazy. Second, the reason I’m cancelling is because I have to attend a memorial service for Professor Tupperman.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: It sounds like a long and tedious evening.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Eh, it will be. Honestly, if I must endure a long and tedious evening, I’d rather it be with you on date night. But I have no choice. The tenure committee’s going to be there.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Oh. Well, in that case, perhaps I should come along.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, now that I think about it, that would be most helpful.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Of course it would. I’m well-versed in academic politics, and as a respected scientist, I can only raise your stock as a candidate.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Actually, I meant you could drive me. But if it makes you happy, that other stuff, too.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Do anything interesting today?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, not really. I was out shopping with Amy. She wanted me to help her find something for this memorial thing.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Wait, Sheldon’s going to be there? We all promised we weren’t going to go.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, what a jerk.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I know. I was hoping to go without anyone finding out.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Well, since Amy’s going, do you want me there? You know, to support you?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, that’s nice, but it-it’s just gonna be a room full of boring old men and I’m not sure how much help you’d be.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay. I’m just gonna tie my shoe while you think about that.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, yeah. No. Thanks, that would be great help. You realize you might kill some of them.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, then you all can get tenure.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Come on, Daddy. All the other scientists have seat warmers. This is so humiliating. I’ve got to get tenure. Okay, let’s meet halfway. How about I cut my cleaning lady down to twice a week? Looks like we’re both going to be living like animals.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Let’s go over our emotional responses one last time.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Professor Tupperman is dead, and that makes us?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Sad.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: The fact that there are so many people here tonight doesn’t make us cranky and claustrophobic. It makes us?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Glad.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Giving Mrs. Davis the box set of Roots was?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Bad. However…

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Fine. Bad.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Unbelievable. You have some nerve showing up here just to schmooze with the tenure committee.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You’re here.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Excuse me. I’m here to pay my respects to Professor Tupperware, or whatever his name is.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: So am I. His passing makes me feel bad.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Well, well, well, Sheldon, fancy meeting you here. I guess the train store in Glendale wasn’t having a cotillion after all. And you, you said you weren’t coming here, either.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I have a thick accent. You don’t know what I said.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I’d like to know why Penny’s here.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I’m here to support my man, just like you.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: What are you going to do? Take people’s drink orders and get them wrong?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Do it.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: What? Did she do it yet?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: She plans on flirting with members of the tenure committee to further Leonard’s cause.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, that’s a fine how-do-you-do. Don’t just stand there. Take your breasts out.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Ooh, meerkat fight!

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: You’re all wasting your time. Sheldon is the most qualified for the job, and no amount of gravity-defying bosom’s going to change that. Seriously, is that tape? Like, how are they staying up like that?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Way to hit ’em with both barrels.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: You two should be ashamed of yourselves. Using women to advance your cause with sexuality, and whatever Amy plans on doing.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Are you implying that my girlfriend has no sexuality to exploit?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Okay, because that was not clear.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Sheldon!

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: What? That was ambiguous.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Well, now it’s biguous. What are you gonna do about it?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Um…

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: You could talk some smack about his mother.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, yes, of course, he wouldn’t like that at all. Last night, I was feeling in need of sexual release when I happened to come across your mother.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Okay, okay. Guys, what are we doing here?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I don’t know what you’re doing, but I was about to insinuate that I had coitus with Raj’s mother for a dollar.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, you do what you want, but I don’t want to lose my friends over tenure. Friends are forever.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: So is tenure.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Walk.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I’m just gonna go home and let my work speak for itself.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: You’re right. This is beneath me. Lie your mother was last night.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: How about it, Sheldon?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: What do you think I should do?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Well, you’ll always be an academic success, but I seriously question whether you’ll make any more friends.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I don’t want any more, but let’s go.

utterance.speaker: Barry
utterance.content: Are you kidding? I would wove to baby-sit for you.

utterance.speaker: Janine
utterance.content: I could not ask you to do that.

utterance.speaker: Barry
utterance.content: Nonsense. Childwen wove me. Something about me just makes them waugh and waugh.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No. We cannot lose to that jerk.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Yeah, screw it. I’m going in.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Wait. Hold on. I believe screw it, I’m going in is what I said to your mother last night. Don’t worry, I didn’t really say that. I find the concept of coitus ridiculous and off-putting.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Should have taken my breasts out while I had the chance.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Mrs Davis? Mrs Davis? Mrs Davis? I know you’re in there. I saw your car in the parking lot.

utterance.speaker: Janine
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I just found out that you recommended myself, Dr. Hofstadter and Dr. Koothrappali to be on the short list for tenure.

utterance.speaker: Janine
utterance.content: Well, despite your quirks, the three of you are very accomplished in your respective fields.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I don’t know what you mean by quirks, but, um, I do want to express my gratitude.

utterance.speaker: Janine
utterance.content: You didn’t bring another gift, did you?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: No, no. No, I learned my lesson. I understand that was inappropriate.

utterance.speaker: Janine
utterance.content: Good.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Anyway, thank you.

utterance.speaker: Janine
utterance.content: You’re welcome. I’m gonna pretend that didn’t happen.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yeah, right on, sister.
